person.persName: William Franklin Hawes, Sr. (Hancock County farmer and captain of the Hancock County Home Guard)

body.p: A Kentucky farmer, soldier, and coal baron. Lived in Hancock County in 1860. Married to Aurelia C. Hawes. Owned twenty-three enslaved persons in 1860. Father of William F. Hawes, Jr., Aurelia Hawes, Ann Hawes, Amelia Hawes, Ed Hawes, and Sue Hawes. Incorporated the Hawes Coal and Manufacturing Company in Hancock County in 1854. Served as a captain in the Hancock County Home Guards in 1861. Served as a captain in the First Kentucky Cavalry (Co. D) (C.S.A.) under General Ben Hardin Helm in 1861 and 1862. Served as a major and assistant quartermaster under J. M. Hawes Command from June 1862 to May 1865.
